newsitem.title: SPAIN: Madrid stocks close at highs, bolstered by Wall St.
newsitem.headline: Madrid stocks close at highs, bolstered by Wall St.

text.p: Madrid stocks overturned sharp early losses to close back at all-time highs on Thursday, fuelled by gains on Wall Street, dealers said.

Despite the fact that for many participants the market is overvalued, a continual stream of funds supported by optimism over Spain's economic outlook means gains will continue to dominate short term, analysts said.
The general index rose 1.73 points, 0.33 percent, to 525.85 and the Ibex added 22.33 points, 0.37 percent, to 6,064.90.
Repsol shed 80 pesetas to 5,960 and Gas Natural fell 620 pesetas to 30,150 on reports of a sharp cut in the gas tariff for industrial users, dealers said.
Other blue chips moved higher again, Endesa rose 100 pesetas to 10,670 after first quarter results.
"The recovery on Wall Street had an immediate effect on our market, which reflects more intensely the positive trends rather than the negative," said a dealer at an independent brokerage.
Market volume totalled around 78 billion pesetas, less than in recent sessions.
